Package tictactoe

Class TicTacToeGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • tictactoe.TicTacToeGame
  • public class TicTacToeGame
extends java.lang.Object
    A game of Tic-Tac-Toe where the size of the game board and the number of game pieces in a row needed to win can be set.
    Author:
    Tapio Malmberg

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static byte COMPUTER
      Represents the computer player.
      private ComputerPlayer computerPlayer
      The computer player
      static byte EMPTY
      Represents an empty square.
      private GameBoard gameBoard
      The game board.
      static int LARGE_GAME_BOARD_SIZE
      The size of the side of a game board from which a game board is considered large.
      private int maxMoves
      The maximum number of moves possible on the game board.
      static int MIN_HEIGHT
      The minimum height allowed for the game board.
      static int MIN_IN_A_ROW_TO_WIN_LARGE
      The minimum allowed number of pieces in a row required to win on a large game board.
      static int MIN_IN_A_ROW_TO_WIN_SMALL
      The minimum allowed number of pieces in a row required to win on a small game board.
      static int MIN_WIDTH
      The minimum width allowed for the game board.
      private int numInARowToWin
      The number of pieces needed in a row to win.
      private int playedMoves
      The total number of moves that have been played by both players.
      static byte PLAYER
      Represents the human player.
      private java.util.Stack<MovePair> undoStack
      A stack of MovePairs for undoing moves.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TicTacToeGame

        public TicTacToeGame​(int width,
                     int height,
                     int numInARowToWin,
                     ComputerPlayer computer,
                     boolean computerStarts)
        Creates a new TicTacToeGame with the given attributes.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the game board
        height - the height of the game board
        numInARowToWin - the number of pieces in a row needed to win
        computer - the computer player
        computerStarts - decides whether the computer gets to make the first move

    • Method Detail

      • isLargeGameBoard

        public static boolean isLargeGameBoard​(int width,
                                       int height)
        Checks whether the given size is considered a large game board.
        Parameters:
        width - the width to test
        height - the height to test
        Returns:
        true if the game board is considered large

      • playARound

        public GameState playARound​(Coordinate playerMove)
        Plays a round of Tic-Tac-Toe with moves by both the human player and the computer.
        Parameters:
        playerMove - the move made by the human player
        Returns:
        the current state of the game

      • reset

        public void reset​(boolean computerStarts)
        Resets the game.
        Parameters:
        computerStarts - decides whether the computer gets to make the first move

      • canUndo

        public boolean canUndo()
        Checks if there are any undoable moves.
        Returns:
        true if a move can be undone

      • undo

        public GameState undo()
        Undoes the previous moves made by the human and the computer.
        Returns:
        returns INVALID_PLAYER_MOVE if no undo is available

      • getGameBoard

        public ImmutableGameBoard getGameBoard()
        Returns the current game board as read-only.
        Returns:
        the game board of this game

      • getLastComputerMove

        public Coordinate getLastComputerMove()
        Returns the last move made by the computer.
        Returns:
        the last move made by the computer or null if no move has been made

      • addUndo

        private void addUndo​(Coordinate playerMove,
                     Coordinate computerMove)
        Adds a move pair to the undo stack.
        Parameters:
        playerMove - the move made by the human player
        computerMove - the move made by the computer player

      • isDrawGame

        private boolean isDrawGame()
        Checks if the game is a draw.
        Returns:
        true if the game is a draw

      • trySetPlayerMove

        private boolean trySetPlayerMove​(Coordinate playerMove)
        Tries to set the player move at the given Coordinate.
        Parameters:
        playerMove - the Coordinate of the player's move
        Returns:
        true if the given move was valid, false otherwise

      • hasWon

        private boolean hasWon​(byte player,
                       Coordinate playedMove)
        Checks if a player has won the game with the given move.
        Parameters:
        player - HUMAN or COMPUTER
        playedMove - the Coordinate of the played move
        Returns:
        true if the given player has won the game

      • makeComputerMove

        private Coordinate makeComputerMove()
        Gets a move from the computer player and sets it on the game board.
        Returns:
        the move the computer player made
